headline: Should Ford’s Big Earnings Beat Despite EV Slump Require Action From Ford Motor (F) Investors?
summary: Ford Motor recently reported quarterly revenue of US$50.53 billion, up 9.4% year on year and ahead of analyst forecasts, delivering earnings and EBITDA that surpassed expectations and marked the strongest analyst beat among major automakers. This outperformance came despite softer U.S. sales, aluminum supply disruptions and a steep 61% decline in EV volumes, underscoring the current importance of Ford’s higher-margin, non-EV operations and hybrids to its overall results. With this earnings...

headline: Ford (F) Valuation Check After Standout Quarter of Revenue Growth and Earnings Beats
summary: Ford Motor (F) just delivered a quarter that caught Wall Street’s attention, with revenue jumping around 9% year over year and earnings comfortably ahead of expectations, helping push the stock higher since the release. See our latest analysis for Ford Motor. The strong quarter has come on top of an already solid run, with Ford’s share price returning 34.3% year to date and its 1 year total shareholder return of 28.7% suggesting momentum is building as investors reassess earnings resilience,...

headline: EVgo Autocharge+ Surpasses 5 Million Sessions and Sixfold Enrollment Growth, Delivering Seamless EV Charging Nationwide
summary: EVgo Autocharge+ EVgo has surpassed five million Autocharge+ sessions. More than 300,000 customer accounts have enrolled over the last three years, representing a sixfold growth since 2022. LOS ANGELES, Dec. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO) (“EVgo” or the “Company”), one of the nation’s largest providers of public fast charging infrastructure for electric vehicles (EVs), has surpassed five million Autocharge+ sessions.
